title: How to remove experiment and related artifacts in minio and entries in mysql.
body:
Hello, we are currently using the following products:

mlflow-1.21.0
mysql-server:8.0.27  (backend-store)
minio/minio:RELEASE.2020-10-09T22-55-05Z (artifact store)

All of these products are deployed to docker.

In mlflow we have a test experiment:
![screen-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577636-211c60a2-8c70-43de-a1d8-a798247b4b2f.png)

The artifacts of this experiment are stored in minio:
![screen-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577688-7cb29029-f38d-48a1-bb0e-21ef686364be.png)

We are removing this experiment from the mlflow GUI:
![screen-3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577743-f27f3ffd-ac73-4740-99be-17dcfaf3e64a.png)

As you can see in the graphical interface, there is no more experiment with this name:
![screen-4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577761-6104982e-d9c9-4c36-b599-fdc2c205ba38.png)

We are trying to create an experiment with the same name and we get the following error:
MlflowException: Cannot set a deleted experiment 'test' as the active experiment. You can restore the experiment, or permanently delete the  experiment to create a new one.
![screen-5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577795-5d897e77-477f-45c5-8a30-81f46315328c.png)

That is, information about the experiment named test remained in the mysql database.

If you check the artifacts related to this experiment in minio, then they also did not disappear:
![screen-6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49237188/144577844-de0a0fee-4489-4b4e-8aa5-690e55b225b6.png)

Please clarify why this is happening? Why deleting an experiment is just about removing metadata from the GUI?

Please clarify how you can automate the cleaning of records in mysql about a remote experiment, as well as cleaning up artifacts associated with a remote experiment in minio?
